intro: Urceodiscus arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis urn-leaf plant, is a unique species characterized by its distinctive urn-shaped leaves. This plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of Central America. Its foliage exhibits a striking contrast between the deep green upper surface and the lighter, often silver-tinged underside. The flowers are typically small, tubular, and come in shades of pink or white, adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
